addAccount(Account) - Method in interface com.stormpath.sdk.group.Group
Assigns the specified Account to this Group.
addAccount(String) - Method in interface com.stormpath.sdk.group.Group
Assigns this Group to the specified Account represented by its (case insensitive) username, email or href

Immediate Execution: Unlike other Group methods, you do not need to call Saveable.save() afterwards.

addAccountStore(AccountStore) - Method in interface com.stormpath.sdk.application.Application
Creates a new ApplicationAccountStoreMapping for this Application and appends that ApplicationAccountStoreMapping to the end of the Application's ApplicationAccountStoreMapping list, allowing the associated accountStore to be used as a source of accounts that may login to the Application.

addAccountStore(AccountStore) - Method in interface com.stormpath.sdk.organization.Organization
Creates a new OrganizationAccountStoreMapping for this Organization and appends that OrganizationAccountStoreMapping to the end of the Organization's OrganizationAccountStoreMapping list, allowing the association accountStore to be used as a source of accounts that may login to the Organization.

ApiKey - Interface in com.stormpath.sdk.api

CustomDataPermissionResolver - Class in com.stormpath.spring.security.provider

doAuthenticate(ProviderAuthenticationToken) - Method in class com.stormpath.spring.security.provider.AbstractSpringSecurityProviderResultListener
 
doConfigure(HttpSecurity) - Method in class com.stormpath.spring.config.StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer
Deprecated.
Instead, extend WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter and configure the HttpSecurity object using the stormpath() utility method. For example: 

 import static com.stormpath.spring.config.StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer.stormpath;

 @Configuration
 public class SecurityConfig extends WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter {

     @Override
     public void configure(HttpSecurity http) throws Exception {
        http.apply(stormpath())
        //other http config here
     }
 }
The old way:

Convenience Hook Method that will be invoked by StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer.doConfigure(HttpSecurity) after configuring all the properties required by Stormpath. You can override this method to define app-specific security settings like: 

 http
   .authorizeRequests()
   .antMatchers("/account").fullyAuthenticated()
   .antMatchers("/admin").hasRole("ADMIN");
doConfigure(AuthenticationManagerBuilder) - Method in class com.stormpath.spring.config.StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer
Deprecated.
Instead, extend WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter and configure the HttpSecurity object using the stormpath() utility method. For example: 

 import static com.stormpath.spring.config.StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer.stormpath;

 @Configuration
 public class SecurityConfig extends WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter {

     @Override
     public void configure(HttpSecurity http) throws Exception {
        http.apply(stormpath())
        //other http config here
     }
 }
The old way:

Convenience Hook Method that will be invoked by StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer.doConfigure(AuthenticationManagerBuilder) after configuring all the properties required by Stormpath. You can override this method to define app-specific ones.

doConfigure(WebSecurity) - Method in class com.stormpath.spring.config.StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer
Deprecated.
Instead, extend WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter and configure the HttpSecurity object using the stormpath() utility method. For example: 

 import static com.stormpath.spring.config.StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer.stormpath;

 @Configuration
 public class SecurityConfig extends WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter {

     @Override
     public void configure(HttpSecurity http) throws Exception {
        http.apply(stormpath())
        //other http config here
     }
 }
The old way:

Convenience Hook Method that will be invoked by StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer.doConfigure(WebSecurity) after configuring all the properties required by Stormpath. You can override this method to define app-specific ones.

Creates a new SamlIdpUrlBuilder that allows you to build a URL you can use to redirect your application users to a SAML authentication site (Identity Provider or IdP) for performing common user identity functionality.

Tenant - Interface in com.stormpath.sdk.tenant
A Tenant represents a customer's private data 'space' within Stormpath that contains all of the customer's Stormpath-stored resources, like Applications, Directories, Accounts and Groups.
TenantActions - Interface in com.stormpath.sdk.tenant
The TenantActions interface represents common tenant actions (behaviors) that can be executed on a Tenant instance or a Client instance acting on behalf of its current tenant.

A Tenant-specific Criteria class, enabling a Tenant-specific fluentquery DSL.

Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated groupMemberships are also retrieved in the same request (paginated).
withGroupMemberships(int) - Method in interface com.stormpath.sdk.account.AccountOptions
Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated Account.getGroupMemberships() groupMemberships} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), limiting the first page of GroupMembership results to limit items.

Ensures that when retrieving an Account, the Account's associated Account.getGroupMemberships() groupMemberships} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), with the first page of GroupMembership results starting at the specified offset index and limiting the number of results to limit items.

X509SigningCert - Interface in com.stormpath.sdk.cert
An X.509 certificate, usually used for RSA cryptographic signature validation.
